note.p: Burial: Cemetery of Pere-Lachaise, Paris, France

Career: Entered the Royal Navy (1777); Lieutenant, for bravery at Cape St Vincent, (1780); Captain (1782); taken prisoner by the French (1796) but escaped (1798); commanded the "Tigre" in the Levant and held the town of St Jean d'Acre against Napoleon (1799); destroyed the Turkish fleet of Abydos (1807); Vice Admiral of the Blue (1810); Admiral (1821); lived last years in Paris
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1840 No 45 p 264
Notes: alt name in Proc Roy Soc 1840 No 45 p 264. 'Saml Carlisle' is Samuel Goodenough, Bishop of Carlisle
